intro: Graphardisia paquitensis, commonly known as the Philippine sandstone vine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often climbing on trees or shrubs. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of Philippine flora.
